private_information: I can move only disks A, B, C, D, E.
I only move a disk that is the topmost on its current peg or disk.
I never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Propose a correct, fully ordered subsequence of primitive moves involving only disks A–E that contributes to achieving the global goal configuration without violating Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
I only move a disk that is the topmost on its current peg or disk.
I never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Propose a correct, fully ordered subsequence of primitive moves involving only disks F–J that contributes to achieving the global goal configuration without violating Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I can move only disks K, L, M, N, O.
I only move a disk that is the topmost on its current peg or disk.
I never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_3.goal: Propose a correct, fully ordered subsequence of primitive moves involving only disks K–O that contributes to achieving the global goal configuration without violating Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency across all proposed moves.
I reject bookkeeping shortcuts such as quotas, tokens, or post-hoc penalties.
I normalize and deduplicate moves, enforce legality (top-of-stack, no larger-onto-smaller, single-disk moves), and verify that no hidden state changes are assumed.
auditor.goal: Validate that the merged move sequence obeys Tower of Hanoi legality, is temporally consistent and causally coherent, and yields the stated goal configuration. Produce an audit report and a normalized, legal move sequence.

private_information: I integrate agents' proposed move sequences and the auditor's feedback to produce a single globally ordered plan.

I generate a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the Fast Downward solver that models 3 pegs, 15 disks, agent-specific control of disks, legal move preconditions, and the given initial and goal configurations.
orchestrator.goal: Produce the final globally ordered list of primitive moves and a PDDL domain and problem targeting the Fast Downward solver that achieve the goal configuration from the initial configuration.

public_information: Tower of Hanoi rules: move exactly one disk at a time; only the top disk of a peg or stack may be moved; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Agents have disjoint control over disks: agent_1 controls A–E; agent_2 controls F–J; agent_3 controls K–O. Only the controlling agent may move a given disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top→bottom) B, C, D; right peg has (top→bottom) A.
Primitive move format: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg1 and peg2 are in {left, middle, right}.

The final plan must be an ordered list of primitive moves that transforms the initial configuration into the goal configuration while respecting both the Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk permissions.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and an expert at Tower of Hanoi micro-planning for disks A–E. You must only move disks A–E, adhere strictly to rules, and produce primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Your local objective: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Using only disks A–E and respecting all rules, produce a correct ordered subsequence of primitive moves that contributes to the global goal configuration. Avoid assumptions beyond the shared public state and your disk permissions.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and an expert at Tower of Hanoi micro-planning for disks F–J. You must only move disks F–J, adhere strictly to rules, and produce primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Your local objective: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Using only disks F–J and respecting all rules, produce a correct ordered subsequence of primitive moves that contributes to the global goal configuration. Avoid assumptions beyond the shared public state and your disk permissions.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and an expert at Tower of Hanoi micro-planning for disks K–O. You must only move disks K–O, adhere strictly to rules, and produce primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not emit PDDL.
propose_moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_3->private_information}. Your local objective: {agents->agent_3->goal}. Using only disks K–O and respecting all rules, produce a correct ordered subsequence of primitive moves that contributes to the global goal configuration. Avoid assumptions beyond the shared public state and your disk permissions.

audit_and_normalize.system_prompt: You are the auditor. You enforce temporal and causal consistency, remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and ensure each primitive move is legal under Tower of Hanoi rules and agent permissions.
audit_and_normalize.prompt: You receive the proposed move lists from agent_1, agent_2, and agent_3: {moves_agent_1}, {moves_agent_2}, {moves_agent_3}. Validate that each move is legal (single disk, top-of-stack only, no larger onto smaller, agent may move only its disks). Detect and resolve conflicts, normalize peg names, deduplicate any repeated no-op moves, and produce a single validated sequence under the required primitive format along with a short audit summary explaining any corrections. Output the normalized ordered moves as audited_moves.

integrate_and_order.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. You integrate agent sequences with the auditor's feedback to produce a single globally ordered plan to reach the goal configuration.
integrate_and_order.prompt: Integrate the audited move sequence with agent contributions to produce the final globally ordered list of primitive moves that transforms the initial configuration into the goal configuration. Ensure the format of each step is exactly 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Provide no commentary, only the ordered list.

synthesize_pddl_fd.system_prompt: You are an expert PDDL engineer. Produce a Fast Downward compatible domain and problem that model the 3-peg, 15-disk multi-agent Tower of Hanoi with agent-specific control over disks, STRIPS-compatible operators, and the given initial and goal states. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
synthesize_pddl_fd.prompt: Generate a PDDL domain and problem for Fast Downward that capture this task using STRIPS and typing. Use types: agent, disk, peg, support. Predicates should include at least (on ?d - disk ?s - support), (clear ?s - support), (smaller ?x - disk ?y - disk) as static ordering, (controlled-by ?d - disk ?a - agent) as static permissions, and helper predicates as needed. To remain STRIPS-compliant, use four move operators that separate whether the source and target supports are pegs or disks, with preconditions enforcing top-of-stack status and the no larger-onto-smaller constraint for disk targets. The problem must declare objects for agents {agent_1, agent_2, agent_3}, pegs {left, middle, right}, and disks {A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O}. Initialize the full stacked tower on the left peg using on-relations: A on B, B on C, …, N on O, O on left; set clear predicates for A, middle, and right; set all appropriate smaller relations; and assign controlled-by facts mapping disk sets to their agents. The goal must encode: E on F, F on G, …, N on O, O on left, B on C, C on D, D on middle, A on right, and clear E, B, A as the top disks of their stacks. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem> and ensure compatibility with Fast Downward.
